name: milkshake

a drink made of milk and ice cream and a flavour such as fruit or chocolate, mixed together until it is smooth : a chocolate milkshake I grabbed a milk shake.
Debby Lewis-Harrison/Cultura/GettyImages
UK a drink made of milk and a flavour such as fruit or chocolate: The chocolate milkshake was thin, and so sweet that you got toothache just looking at it. We washed down our meal with an old-fashioned milkshake made from skimmed milk and fruit.
More examplesFewer examplesHis favourite indulgence is a cheeseburger washed down with a strawberry milkshake. The pineapple milkshakes were outstanding.The shop also sells burgers, hot dogs, ice cream, and milk shakes.
